Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I came here on purpose to see you.

Vocabularies.Definition: ahead in time 预先,事先
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You must pay for the book in advance.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. have as parts or members 包含,包括;由…组成
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The committee comprises men of widely different views.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make a movement that tells (sb.) what to do 以动作示意
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She motioned to the waiter.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. become suited (to new conditions, etc.) 适应
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You can't see well through a telescope unless it is adjusted correctly to your sight.

Vocabularies.Definition: produce by thought; devise 想出;设计出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There's no knowing what he'll think up next.

Vocabularies.Definition: meanwhile 在此期间;与此同时
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Please find a taxi, and in the meantime I'll pack some food.
e.g.  It is generally hot in summer.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. attraction; interest 感染力;吸引力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  That sort of music hasn't much appeal for me.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. fight or serious disagreement 冲突
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. There is a clash of views between us.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. stand for or be a sign or symbol of 代表;象征
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We chose a committee to represent us.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. honest and respectable 正派的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Poor people cannot always live in decent conditions.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. great wickedness 邪恶   a. wicked, very bad 邪恶的,极坏的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The love of money is the root of all evils.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. acting or done willingly 自愿的;自动的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She is a voluntary worker at the hospital.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. suppose (sth.) to be a fact 假定,假设
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You assume that he is innocent before hearing the evidence against him.
